data.title: Republican Senator Introduces Bill to Regulate Stablecoins—What You Need to Know
data.description:
TL;DR Senator Bill Hagerty seeks to establish a favorable regulatory framework for stablecoins in the U.S. The proposal requires stablecoins to be backed by dollars, Treasury bonds, and Federal Reserve notes.  The project aims to position the U.S. as the global epicenter of crypto-innovation by establishing a clear and transparent infrastructure for the development of ... 
source: https://crypto-economy.com/republican-senator-introduces-bill-to-regulate-stablecoins-what-you-need-to-know/

data.title: Crypto.com plans to file Cronos ETF, launch stablecoin in 2025
data.description:
The cryptocurrency exchange recently secured a MiCA license, allowing it to provide services throughout the European Economic Area.
source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/crypto-com-cronos-etf-launch-stablecoin-2025?utm_source=rss_feed&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss_partner_inbound

data.title: Ionic platform on Mode attacked, hackers used fake LBTC as collateral
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News According to the official announcement of Ionic, the Mode-based Ionic platform was hacked, and the hacker used unofficial fake LBTC (Lombard BTC) as collateral for the Ionic platform. The team is investigating, and Odaily reminds users not to interact with it.
The original link is attached with the official LBTC contract address query.

data.title: FTX Repayments Begin February 18, Claims Under $50,000 Eligible
data.description:
FTX announces distributions for Convenience Class claims under $50,000 starting Feb 18, 2025. Funds include adjudicated claim value + 9% interest.

source: https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/25/02/43469427/ftx-repayments-begin-february-18-claims-under-50000-eligible?utm_source=cryptopanic.com&utm_campaign=partner_feed&utm_medium=partner_feed&utm_content=site

data.title: This Will Test Your Patience! Next For Bitcoin!!
Breaking: FTX to Begin Repayments to Creditors From February 18
data.description:
The post Breaking: FTX to Begin Repayments to Creditors From February 18 appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News
In a latest development, FTX is all set to begin repayments to creditors from February 18. According to an email circulated among FTX creditors, they will begin getting reimbursed for lost assets. These payouts will begin at 10 AM ET on February 18 and will only apply to claims...
source: https://coinpedia.org/news/breaking-ftx-to-begin-repayments-to-creditors-from-february-18/

data.title: US lawmakers will propose crypto regulation by Nov — Anthony Scaramucci
data.description:
The former White House communications director reportedly suggested that members of Congress running for reelection ”don’t want to be opposed by the crypto industry.”
